News and Info

Here is where you will be able to find additional details about any major service change or update we have.

12/08/2025: End of Fall Semester Service & Winter Session Schedule

As the Fall 2025 semester comes to an end, OCCT will end service early the evening of Friday, 12/12, following the Last Day of Service Master Schedule. After, there will be NO SERVICE until 12/15.


OCCT will operate the ITC/Campus Shuttle (ICS) from Monday, 12/15, to Tuesday, 12/23 & Monday, 1/5, to Friday, 1/16. The ICS will be the ONLY bus in service for the winter session and will operate in a green shuttle starting from Mohawk between 8:00 AM and 5:30 PM on weekdays. Please refer to the Winter Session ICS Master Schedule for the full list & details.


Thank you all for a wonderful semester, Bearcats! Take care, and enjoy the winter break & holiday season!


See you in the Spring!

12/04/2025: Saturday (12/06) Modified Service

On Saturday, 12/06, OCCT will be operating on an Alternate Master Schedule (12/06) for the day. There will be direct UDC shuttles from the main campus to UDC and back in the morning & afternoon. In addition, several routes will run at adjusted times, differing from the standard Saturday schedule, so please plan accordingly.


Regular service will resume on Sunday, 12/07, following the Fall 2025 Full Master Schedule.

11/20/2025: Thanksgiving Week Service Update (11/25-11/30)

In observance of Thanksgiving, OCCT will be operating on a modified schedule for Tuesday, 11/25, & Wednesday, 11/26. On Tuesday, service will end early at 10:45 PM, and on Wednesday, there will ONLY be ICS service from 8:00 AM to 12:00 PM. Please refer to the Thanksgiving Week Master Schedule (11/25 & 11/26) for the full list of runs and their times.


There will be NO SERVICE from Thursday, 11/27, through Sunday, 11/30. Regular service will resume on Monday, 12/1, following the Fall 2025 Full Master Schedule.


Enjoy the holiday and break, Bearcats!

11/20/2025: Saturday (11/22) Modified Service

On Saturday, 11/22, OCCT will be operating on an Alternate Master Schedule (11/22) for the day. There will be direct UDC shuttles from the main campus to UDC and back in the morning & afternoon. In addition, several routes will run at adjusted times, differing from the standard Saturday schedule, so please plan accordingly.

10/22/2025: Rejuvenation Day & Weekend Modified Service (10/24 - 10/26)

In observance of Rejuvenation Day on Friday, 10/24, OCCT will be operating on a modified scheudule from 10/24 to 10/26. Please refer to the Fall 2025
Rejuvenation Day & Weekend Master Schedule for the full list of runs and their times.


There will be no late nite on Friday, 10/24, or Saturday, 10/25. In addition, the Campus Shuttle will be operating on scheduled, non-continuous loops in a Blue Bus from Mohawk on Friday, 10/24, to Sunday, 10/26.


ITC service will operate every twenty minutes in a Green Campus Shuttle from Mohawk between 8:00 AM and 5:40 PM on Friday, 10/24.


Regular serivce will return on Monday, 10/27, following the Fall 2025 Full Master Schedule.


Enjoy the long weekend, Bearcats!

9/28/2025: Downtown Southside Route Change

Effective Monday, 9/29, the Downtown Southside (DS) will no longer service Vestal Avenue and the stops along it (Larchmont, Hawthorne, Brookfield, Rush). Instead, the DS will utilize Vestal Pkwy before and after servicing Conklin Avenue. The rest of the route will remain unaffected -- servicing Conklin Avenue, Tompkins St, and BC Junction. Please refer to the DS page for the updated map & info here. In addition, due to the nature of the route change, the S. Washington stop for the DS Outbound has been moved to in front of the Indulgence Salon. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

9/14/2025: Fall 2025 Master Schedule Edits

In efforts of continuous improvement, OCC Transport has made some adjustments to the Fall 2025 Master Schedule to increase the amount of inbounds to the main campus before 8:00 A.M.; therefore, certain outbound departure times have been changed. Please refer to the Fall 2025 Full Master Schedule for the updated times. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

8/8/2025: Fall 2025 Semester Schedules & Service Bulletin

Welcome to the Fall 2025 Semester, Bearcats! OCC Transport is excited to be back to full service, with some improvements and new additions to make your commute better this semester.

OCCT is proud to introduce its newly extended and improved routes: Vestal Shopping Shuttle (VS), Oakdale Commons Shuttle (OC), and Downtown Southside (DS) Inbound!

Formerly known as the Rivera Ridge Town Square Mall Shuttle (RRT), the RRT has been renamed the Vestal Shopping Shuttle (VS). It now follows the same route as before, including stops at favorites like Target and Walmart, but with an extended route. Additionally, The Shoppes at Vestal and Campus Plaza are now key destinations. The entire route takes 45 minutes, and ALL VS OUTBOUNDS DEPART FROM THE UNION, NOT RAFUSE.

The Oakdale Commons Shuttle (OC) has also been extended. After servicing the Oakdale Commons and Wegmans stops, it continues to stop at Aldi on Harry L Drive and at Five Below. The total trip takes about 35 minutes, with ALL OC OUTBOUNDS DEPARTING FROM THE UNION, NOT RAFUSE.

The demand for bus service in Binghamton’s Southside neighborhood has grown significantly over the past few semesters; however, OCCT was unable to meet that demand earlier due to a labor shortage. When the Downtown Southside (DS) Outbound route was introduced last year, it only operated after 6 P.M. with four runs each night. Now, on weekdays, the DS Outbound starts at 7 A.M., and the newly DS Inbound begins at 8 A.M., totaling 31 DS runs each weekday!

As we begin the semester, please remember to scan your ID when boarding and follow all bus rules and regulations. This ensures that you’re BU-affiliated for the driver and helps OCCT expand service accordingly with accurate ridership data. Drivers will remind passengers to scan IDs over the first few weeks and may deny boarding if an ID cannot be presented.

OCCT is now accepting applications for our Fall 2 Training class! If you're 18 or older, have had a U.S. driver's license for at least a year, and have no active violations or points, apply to become a driver of our iconic blue buses! Visit occtransport.org/pages/employment for more details.

We look forward to providing you with another semester of safe, courteous, and reliable transportation. Best of luck this semester, and thank you for making OCCT great!

For more details on these changes, please visit occtransport.org or go to occtransport.org/pages/contactus to ask questions.

- Andrew Monti, Public Relations Coordinator
pr@occtransport.org | 607-777-6916

Congratulations to those who are graduating, and we look forward to seeing everyone else back in the Fall!

4/27/2025: Oakdale Commons Stop Change

Given the adjustment in construction at the Oakdale Commons, OCCT will be servicing the mall in a different location. The stop has now moved to the front of the mall near Dave & Buster's. For more information, please visit the Oakdale Commons stop page.

1/13/2025: Spring 2025 Semester Schedules & Service Bulletin

Welcome to the Spring 2025 Semester, Bearcats! We hope you had a restful winter break and an enjoyable holiday season. OCC Transport is happy to be back running with improvements and updates to service.

Our drive for recruitment has allowed us to replenish staffing levels enough to increase service hours by approximately 9.7% this semester! In particular, an additional 8 DCL Inbounds have been added on weekdays, and each downtown route has seen an increase in frequency throughout the week. The same routes operated last semester will continue this semester. The start of the DS Inbound operation has been postponed as we continue to research housing and ridership data in the Southside.

Certain peak inbound buses in the morning that are prone to getting full will also have additional “chaser” buses that will pick up remaining passengers on Main St. after Chestnut St. after the first bus gets full. Certain WS, DCL, MS, and UDC Inbounds will still be skipping Academic Ato avoid traffic congestion around West Drive during class changes. Please review the schedules for each inbound route to see which specific runs will skip Academic A.

We would also like to courteously remind you a valid Binghamton University ID is required to ride and must be presented and scanned each time you board. This ensures that you're BU-affiliated for the driver and helps OCCT expand service accordingly with accurate ridership data. When boarding, please have your ID out before approaching the steps to prevent delays. Drivers will remind passengers to scan IDs when boarding for the first few weeks and reserve the right to deny boarding if an ID cannot be presented.

OCCT is currently taking applications for our Spring 2 Training class! If you're 18 or older, had a U.S. driver's license for at least one year, with no active violations or points, apply to drive the iconic blue buses! Visit occtransport.org/pages/employment for more information.

As always, please remember to follow the rules when riding and be courteous to our drivers and fellow passengers. We look forward to another semester of providing safe, courteous, and reliable transportation. Best of luck in the semester, and thank you for continuing to be what makes OCCT so great!

- Arjun Sahansra, Public Relations Coordinator
pr@occtransport.org | 607-777-6916

12/5/2024: Fall 2024 Semester Service Ending & Winter Break Service

As the Fall 2024 semester comes to an end, OCC Transport will be ending service early on Friday, December 13th. The final runs to leave campus that evening will be:


5:45 Main Street Outbound (MS OUT)
6:00 Downtown Southside Outbound (DS OUT)
6:45 UClub Shuttle (UC)
6:45 Westside Outbound (WS OUT)
6:45 Downtown Center-Leroy Outbound (DCL OUT)
7:00 Campus Shuttle (CS)


Winter ITC-Campus Shuttle service will begin on Monday, 12/16, and continue through the Winter Session. Exact service dates & schedules will release shortly. We'd like to thank everyone for a great semester - we appreciate you and look forward to a great upcoming Spring! Enjoy your Winter Break & Happy Holidays, Bearcats!

11/13/2024: Thanksgiving Break Service Information

In observance of Thanksgiving Break, OCCT will be reducing service from Wednesday, 11/27 to Sunday, 12/1. A modified reduced schedule that ends before 12:00 PM will be in effect on Wednesday, 11/27. There will be no service from Thursday, 11/28 to Sunday, 12/1. Normal service will resume on Monday, 12/2.


We hope you have a restful and enjoyable Thanksgiving Break!

10/30/2024: Main St (MS) Detour Ending

As a result of the Lester Ave. bridge being open to traffic again, the Gannett Building will be serviced directly through Lester Ave. on the Main St (MS) Outbound & Inbound.

We hope this alleviates any delays or issues caused by the modified routing from the start of the semester. We appreciate your patience and understanding as we previously worked through this detour!

9/4/2024: Academic A Service Changes

Due to increased traffic during class change times, certain WS, DCL, MS & UDC Inbound runs will begin skipping Academic A upon entering campus by servicing the Union via East Drive instead of West Drive. Avoiding this pedestrian & vehicle traffic near Lecture Hall & Academic A at these peak times will ensure that we continue to operate as close to on-time as possible and get passengers to/from class safely.

Information on the specific runs that will skip Academic A will be posted shortly. We apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your understanding and patience as we get into the groove of another great semester!

For more information regarding this change, please contact pr@occtransport.org.

8/20/2024: Main St (MS) Service to Gannett Building & JC Walmart

Effective this semester, Main St (MS) Outbound & Inbounds will begin to service the BU Gannett Building & Walmart in North Johnson City. During the Lester Ave. bridge closure, buses will detour via Arch St. & Brocton St. to service this area instead. We appreciate your patience as we work through this detour and service this new area!

8/5/2024: Fall 2024 Semester Schedules & Service Bulletin

Welcome to the Fall 2024 Semester, Bearcats! OCC Transport is happy to be back running full service with some improvements and additions to service for you this semester.

OCCT is proud to introduce a new route, the Downtown Southside (DS)! This route provides service between Main Campus and the UDC via Southside neighborhoods and Downtown Binghamton. This semester, it will only run in the Outbound direction (Campus to UDC) in the evening hours when BC Transit stops operating the 5. As we increase staffing levels and review passenger demand, a mirrored Inbound run will begin operating in the following semesters. Visit occtransport.org/pages/ds for more information!

Since the release of the Downtown Southside, we will no longer be operating the Leroy Southside (LRS). Being the oldest route in our roster, operating since the early 1990s, this route’s service area is currently covered by other routes throughout our service hours and therefore defunct.

Since our staffing levels have decreased from the previous year, we have slightly reduced service and will operate one less bus daily. This amounts to roughly a 9.5% decrease in service. As a result, we have shifted more residential runs (WS, DCL) to direct UDC service to ensure the same or more frequent service to/from the UDC as in previous semesters. We hope to return service frequency to previous numbers in the following semesters as we replenish our staffing levels in upcoming training classes.

All other runs will continue operating at frequencies similar to previous semesters. However, certain run times may have changed – please visit occtransport.org/pages/routeschedule for the most up-to-date schedules.

OCCT is currently taking applications for our Fall 2 Training class! If you're 18 or older, had a U.S. driver's license for at least one year, with no active violations or points, apply to drive the iconic blue buses! Visit occtransport.org/pages/employment for more information.

As we get into the semester, please remember to scan your ID when boarding the bus, and follow all rules of riding the bus. We look forward to another semester of providing you with safe, courteous, and reliable transportation. Best of luck in the semester, and thank you for continuing to be what makes OCCT so great!

For more information regarding the changes noted, please visit occtransport.org, or visit occtransport.org/pages/contactus to ask any questions.

- Arjun Sahansra, Public Relations Coordinator
pr@occtransport.org | 607-777-6916

8/4/2024: Introducing Our New Route: The Downtown Southside

OCCT is proud to announce our new route, the Downtown Southside (DS)! This route services Vestal Ave, Conklin Ave, and Tompkins St in Southside Binghamton, then Henry St, BC Junction, and the Universiy Downtown Center in Downtown Binghamton. Designed to replace the Leroy Southside (LRS), this route will begin operating in the Fall 2024 only in the outbound direction. Check out our Facebook, Instagram, or Route Webpage for more information!
